intro: Sicyos chaetocephalus, commonly known as the hairy ball gourd, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, spherical fruits. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with palmate leaves and yellow flowers. Its fruit is edible when mature and has a fibrous, starchy texture. Sicyos chaetocephalus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and traditional uses in local cuisines.
